present.english: The friendly baker sells the hot bread
The busy markets sell the sweet fruit

imperfect.english: I was selling the old book
The friendly baker was selling the hot bread
The busy markets were selling the sweet fruit

future.english: I will sell the old book
The friendly baker will sell the hot bread
The busy markets will sell the sweet fruit

aorist.english: The friendly baker sold the hot bread
The busy markets sold the sweet fruit

optative.english: I should sell the old book

optative.georgian: მეგობრულმა მცხობელმა უნდა გაყიდოს ცხელი პური
optative.english: The friendly baker should sell the hot bread

optative.georgian: დაკავებულმა ბაზრებმა უნდა გაყიდონ ტკბილი ხილი
optative.english: The busy markets should sell the sweet fruit

imperative.english: You all (you formal), sell the new phone
